name: 2.10 "Just Three Friends" Online Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 2 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What did Coach get to protect the bar?
questions.explanation:
a big dog.

	Coach put the dog in Sam's office. However, no one could get into the office because the dog was so dangerous.

Heather.

	Heather was very flirtatious but meant no harm. Sometimes people mistook her flirting for something more serious.

questions.text: What did Cliff say women were hung up on?
questions.explanation:
looks, personality and style.

	If Sam was a Lothario then Cliff was an anti-Lothario. He never seemed to be able to get a date.

questions.text: Who did Sam think had the hots for him?
questions.explanation:
Heather.

	He was convinced that Heather was after him and was concerned about how that would affect her friendship with Diane. Diane didn't believe it when he told her but later on started to get worried.

Sam and Heather.

	The three of them together was how this episode got its title, "Just Three Friends". Sam and Heather had a wonderful time while Diane became more and more concerned that Heather was after Sam.

questions.text: What was the closest Sam had ever come to saying "no" to a woman?
questions.explanation:
"Not now, we're landing."

	Sam told Diane this when he told her that Heather wanted him. He was afraid that he might cheat on her if he was right because he didn't have practice saying no to women.

questions.text: After everyone stopped laughing, who started to crack up?
questions.explanation:
Coach.

	It took Coach a little while to realize why everyone was laughing. Coach was often very slow to pick up on things that the other barflies got easily.

questions.text: What was used to calm the dog?
questions.explanation:
booze.

	It turned out the dog really liked alcohol and it calmed him right down. Once they got him to go to sleep they were able to get him out of the office.

Markie Post.

	Markie Post was best known for portraying the role of Christine Sullivan on "Night Court". She was born Marjorie Armstrong Post on November 4, 1950 in California.

Diane.

	Diane thought Heather was coming on to Sam at dinner. She stood up and knocked over the chair while accusing Heather of using talk of dinner as a pick up line on Sam. She found out that she was mistaken and Heather was hurt because she figured of all people her best friend should understand her.
